p: We estimate the effect of upwelling on yearly stock growth (surplus stock production), defined as the biomass difference between consecutive years plus catches. Data on annual Senegalese and Gambian catches for the period 1995–2013 are taken from the FAO assessment report [ 54]. We add reported catches by legal foreign trawlers from the “Sea around us” data-base [ 55, 56]. The share of the Senegalese purse seine fleet in total harvest fluctuates around 90%, because the stocks’ main habitat is the Senegalese exclusive economic zone, to which other fleets have limited access. A summary of the dataset used in estimation is provided in Section C of the S1 File.
